do you need the kernel source?
please type my name when replying so I get alerted when you talk to me. You can do this:
note down your kernel version with 'uname -a'
go to a friend with internet access, go to packages.ubuntu.com, search for the kernel package.
you might only need kernel-headers-<your-version>, not the whole package, though. It's a smaller download.
im currently running windows from a dual boot
the go to packages.ubuntu.com to learn how to do it for later. Type in "kernel-headers" in the package search box.

yeah, you can download a deb from there, copy it to your linux partition, and install it with dpkg -i <packagename>. Voila :)
good luck. Remember that the version must match exactly the kernel you are using.
